item.title: Cawston Park: Failed hospital's directors still working in residential care
item.description: A coroner says the directors of a hospital where failures led to a man's death still run care homes.

item.title: Migrant women and babies held in shocking conditions, MPs find
item.description: A group of MPs describes scenes at a Dover asylum unit as "wholly inappropriate" and a Covid risk.

item.title: Storm Evert: South West braced for 75mph winds and heavy rain
item.description: Heavy rain and strong winds are expected to hit the region.

item.title: Night camera captures first beaver born in Norfolk in 600 years
item.description: The baby, or kit, was born to a pair of Eurasian beavers introduced to Wild Ken Hill last year.

item.title: FareShare warns of holiday hunger with no school meals
item.description: Food charity FareShare says holiday hunger "is especially bad this year".

item.title: Nightclubs start asking for NHS Covid pass in England
item.description: It comes as the Lib Dems demand MPs debate their use in England amid concerns over discrimination.

item.title: Yorkshire strength of identity revealed by survey answers
item.description: There were more than 4,500 responses to the Yorkshire Society survey collated by Hull's university.

item.title: Convicted terrorist found driving London bin lorries jailed
item.description: Andrew Rowe drove nine different vehicles as part of his work at Hammersmith and Fulham Council.

item.title: Marcus Coutain: Knee-on-neck arrest PC will not face disciplinary action
item.description: Footage showed Marcus Coutain asking an officer to "get off my neck" during his arrest in July 2020.

item.title: Man jailed after fake Amazon delivery driver gun attack
item.description: Vincente Forde disguised himself as an Amazon delivery driver to attack his victim at his home.

item.title: Parton landslide forces families from their homes
item.description: Fourteen houses are evacuated and the main route through the village could be shut for six months.

item.title: Worcester teen dances again after itchy skin 'miracle cure'
item.description: Connie McGrath has gone from staying on the sofa to a "ball of energy" in months.

item.title: Covid: Which children are being vaccinated and why?
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of children at higher risk from coronavirus infection will be offered a Covid vaccine in the UK.

item.title: Why you shouldn't get a second Covid jab too early
item.description: A government scientific advisor tells Newsbeat why four weeks is too soon between Covid jabs.

item.title: Beta coronavirus variant: What is the risk?
item.description: There are fears that this version of coronavirus, first identified in South Africa, is

item.title: Covid rules: How can the clinically vulnerable stay safe?
item.description: As social-distancing and other Covid rules end in England, how can people who were shielding stay safe?

item.title: What are the rules and guidance for face masks and coverings from 19 July?
item.description: Masks are no longer compulsory in England, but remain necessary in Scotland and Wales.

item.title: ‘My dog travelled 50 miles on a bus to Kent’
item.description: Chip the Norfolk terrier jumped on board a double-decker wedding bus by mistake.

item.title: Covid: The doctor sisters working through the pandemic
item.description: Caitlín and Megan Prosser have been supporting each other throughout the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Mikey Poulli: The young blind footballer backed by star players
item.description: Mikey Poulli, who lost his sight due to a rare degenerative condition, dreams of playing for England.

item.title: Leicester asylum seeker: 'My allotment saved my life'
item.description: Joel Chitsa says gardening helped deal with the pain of being forced to leave Zimbabwe.

item.title: 'I wouldn't pay £4 to walk up a hill'
item.description: The public reacts to London's newest tourist attraction, which is facing complaints of being incomplete.

item.title: Pilot's frustration at hotel quarantine during family bereavement
item.description: Ryan Harris' tried to appeal so he could help search for his father-in-law but was refused.

item.title: Chesterfield hospital trust apology over death of newborn baby
item.description: Brody was just over 18 hours old when he died at Chesterfield Royal Hospital in 2019.

item.title: Farmer loses four year legal bid to save alpaca
item.description: Geronimo twice tested positive for bovine TB but his owner refused a government order to cull him.

item.title: Good Samaritan plumber fears company closure
item.description: James Anderson carries out free work for people who might otherwise struggle to afford it.

item.title: Hidden Lake District railway station restored by couple
item.description: Bassenthwaite Lake station took two years to restore after it had been derelict for decades.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Day-by-day guide to the key events, big stars and British medal hopes
item.description: Want to know what's happening when in Tokyo? Check out our comprehensive guide to all the action in Japan.

item.title: Could a Covid-19 'pingdemic' ruin the start of the new football season?
item.description: BBC Sport looks at how the new English football season will cope with Covid-19 testing and contact tracing now that restrictions have been lifted.

item.title: The Hundred: Trent Rockets maintain 100% record with London Spirit win
item.description: Trent Rockets maintain their 100% record in the men's Hundred as they edge past London Spirit in a low-scoring thriller at Lord's.

item.title: Super League: Hull FC 12-22 Leeds Rhinos - Visitors boost play-off hopes
item.description: Leeds Rhinos' second-half fightback keeps their Super League play-off hopes alive in victory against Hull FC.
